sections.title: Sigma Sensors Cowboy Wafer 150/200/300mm
sections.description: Offering unmatched accuracy and reliability in thermal verification, our Cowboy line of RTD Wafers ensure accuracy and documentary traceability of your equipment without the hassle of extra holders or complex setups or manual documentation.

list.title: Universal Compatibility
list.description: designed for universal application across all 200 and 300 mm thermal chucks

list.title: Calibration Automation
list.description: compatible with leading wafer probers and chuck manufacturers including Accretech, ATT, ERS, MPI, Cascade, and more

list.title: Durable and Shatter-Free
list.description: a unique two-layer design increases durability and longevity, and makes handling eaiser

sections.title: Calibration Automation
sections.description: The Cowboy Wafer system offers semi-automated and fully-automated Prober calibration protocols.

list.title: Full-Automation
list.description: operator-free fully automated routine is available for newer MPI and Accretech Probers using newer ATT or ERS controllers

list.title: Semi-Automation
list.description: semi-automated routines consisting of automated temperature stepping with manual offset update available for all probers

sections.title: Data Analysis and Data Export
sections.description: The Cowboy Wafer system offers multiple options for data visualization, export, and networking to meet your needs.

list.title: Data Visualization
list.description: temperature-time graphs and temperature-maps can be visualized in real-time or post-test

list.title: Performance Characterization
list.description: wafer temperature can be characterized by various metrics including mean, median, mode, standard-deviation, range

list.title: Data Export
list.description: data can be exported in multiple formats including CSV, XLSX, and JSON

sections.heading: Accuracy Options
sections.description: Sigma Sensors offers different tiers of calibration and accuracy to help customers balance cost with their performance requirements.

features.title: Factory Spec
features.description: Using high quality sensors and a proprietary calibration process, Sigma Sensors can offer a base sensor-to-sensor accuracy of ±0.1°C and an absolute accuracy of ±0.2°C. This is the most cost-effective option for customers who can tolerate a lower accuracy.

features.title: Factory Calibration
features.description: Increased accuracy is achieved using premium 4-wire PT-100 sensors and an extended calibration process. Sensor-to-sensor accuracy is ±0.05°C and absolute accuracy is ±0.1°C. This is the best option for customers who need a higher accuracy but do not require an ISO/IEC 17025 accredited calibration.

features.title: Accredited Calibration
features.description: The K2X calibration option is the highest accuracy option available and is also the only ISO/IEC 17025 accredited calibration option. Sensor-to-sensor accuracy is ±0.03°C and absolute accuracy is ±0.1°C. This is the best option for customers who require an ISO/IEC 17025 accredited calibration.

sections.heading: Specifications Summary
sections.description: Specification range for the Cowboy wafer series. Exact specifications depend on purchased configuration.

rows.spec: Up to 0.03 K sensor-to-sensor, <0.1 K absolute (4-wire PT-100)
